intro: Laurentia longiflora var. runcinata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf laurentia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native plants with aesthetic appeal.
